Package de.kaleidox.util.objects

Class Evaluation<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.kaleidox.util.objects.Evaluation<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type variable value the result.
    public class Evaluation<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class can be used to run different actions after a predicate. Boolean evaulations can be simplified using of(boolean).

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new Evaluation instance.

      Gets whether the evaluation has succeeded.

      Gets the actual value.

      Creates a new Evaluation instance for a predefined boolean.
      boolean onFailure​(java.util.function.Consumer<T> failureAction)
      Performs an action if the pre-defined Predicate tests FALSE.

      Performs an action if a given Predicate tests FALSE.

      • onSuccess

        public boolean onSuccess​(java.util.function.Consumer<T> successAction)
        Performs an action if the pre-defined Predicate has tested TRUE.
        Parameters:
        successAction - The action to perform if the predicate succeeds.
        Returns:
        Whether the action could be performed. Works similar to getResult().

        successAction - The action to perform if the predicate succeeds.
        Returns:
        Whether the action could be performed. Works similar to getResult().

      • onFailure

        public boolean onFailure​(java.util.function.Consumer<T> failureAction)
        Performs an action if the pre-defined Predicate tests FALSE.
        Parameters:
        failureAction - The action to perform is the predicate succeeds.
        Returns:
        Whether the action was performed.

      • onFailure

        public boolean onFailure​(java.util.function.Predicate<T> tester,
                         java.util.function.Consumer<T> failureAction)
        Performs an action if a given Predicate tests FALSE.
        Parameters:
        tester - The predicate to test with.
        failureAction - The action to perform if the predicate fails.
        Returns:
        Whether the action was performed.

      • evaluate

        public boolean evaluate​(java.util.function.Consumer<T> successAction,
                        java.util.function.Consumer<T> failureAction)
        Performs one of the given action, depending on whether the predicate failed or succeeded.
        Parameters:
        successAction - The action to perform if the predicate succeeds.
        failureAction - The action to perform if the predicate fails.
        Returns:
        Whether the action could be performed. Works similar to getResult().
